The problem is: When do you know that it's time to quit searching?

And the chunks of your brain that are working on setting that quitting criterion and that quitting threshold are being driven into a bad place.

In fact, what we found in the experiment is that typically in these sort of tasks, the time it takes you on average to say `Yes, there is something there' is less than the time it takes you to say no. That makes sense.
You wait around a little while to make sure you didn't miss it.
When the targets were very rare, people were saying no in average amount of time that was faster than the amount of time it takes to say yes, and that's not going to be good.
